intro: Aristeguietia perezioides, commonly known as the Andean moonflower, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, nocturnal blossoms that open at night. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments at high elevations. Its leaves are usually opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture. The flowers are white or pale pink, emitting a subtle fragrance to attract pollinators during the night.
